Scalathrax.name: Scalathrax
Scalathrax.publicNotes:
Diese glitschigen, schuppigen Schrecken leben in den fernen Höhlensystemen der Finsterlande und nisten bevorzugt in engen Spalten. Wenn sie auf der Jagd sind, schleudern sie Stacheln aus ihren langen Beinen oder besprühen ihre Feinde mit einem klaren, giftigen Öl. Dasselbe Öl überzieht den Körper des Scalathrax, und ist stark entflammbar – egal ob es das Opfer oder den Scalarthax benetzt.

Obwohl ein Scarlathax wild zu sein scheint, ist er intelligenter, als es den Anschein hat. Er ist in der Lage, in einer feuchten, schlangenähnlich-zischelnden Stimme zu sprechen. Die Mehrheit der Scarlathaxe ist jähzornig, schnell zu erzürnen und mordlustig. Man kann sich mit einem Scarlathax verbünden, benötigt dann aber entweder eine ständige Bestechung mit an zu töteten Kreaturen oder eine besonders einschüchternde Persönlichkeit. Denn Scarlataxe respektieren häufig Schikaneure, da sie in ihnen ein Spiegelbild ihrer eigenen grausamen Werte wiedererkennen.

action->Oily Scales.name: Ölige Schuppen
action->Oily Scales.description: Ein Scalathrax sondert ständig ein glitzerndes Öl aus, das es außergewöhnlich glitschig macht. Er behandelt das Ergebnis eines Wurfes für Akrobatik zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Hindurchzwängen} oder jeden anderen Fähigkeitswurf zu @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Entkommen} als um einen Grad besser ist als das gewürfelte Ergebnis. Der Scalathrax verliert diesen Vorteil für 1 Minute, sobald er Feuerschaden in beliebiger Höhe erleidet.

action->Scalathrax Venom.name: Scalathraxgift
action->Scalathrax Venom.description:
Rettungswurf @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]{Zähigkeitswurf}

Maximale Wirkungsdauer 6 Runden

Phase 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 1} (1 Runde)

Phase 2 Unbeholfen 1 und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Verlangsamt 1} (1 Runde)

Phase 3 Unbeholfen 1 und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Verlangsamt 2} (1 Runde)

action->Spray Toxic Oil.name: Giftiges Öl versprühen
action->Spray Toxic Oil.description:
Der Scalathrax speit eine Gischt an giftigem Öl aus seinem Maul in einem @Template[type:cone|distance:15]{15 Fuß/4,50 m-Kegel}. Kreaturen im Wirkungsbereich müssen einen @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect]{Reflexwurf} ablegen. Der Scalathrax kann diese Fähigkeit erst nach [[/br 1d4 #Runden]]{1W4 Runden} wieder einsetzen.

Kritischer Erfolg Die Kreatur ist nicht betroffen.

Erfolg Die Kreatur nimmt @Damage[1d8[poison]]{1W8 Punkte Giftschaden}.

Fehlschlag Die Kreatur nimmt @Damage[2d8[poison]]{2W8 Punkte Giftschaden}. Für 1 Minute erhält die Kreatur Schwäche gegen Feuer 5 und immer, wenn die Kreatur in dieser Zeit mit einer geführten Waffe beim Angriffswurf einen Kritischen Fehlschlag erzielt, lässt sie die Waffe fallen.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Wie beim Fehlschlag, aber @Damage[4d8[poison]]{4W8 Punkte Giftschaden}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.75B7z49jfQbWcSy9]{Effekt: Giftiges Öl versprühen}

Seugathi Guard.name: Seugathi Guard
Seugathi Guard.publicNotes:
The most common seugathis spawned by neothelids are seugathi servants. Their masters equip them with tools useful in their tasks (often a wand and a weapon), and they rarely value other material things beyond their usefulness in completing their imprinted mission.

The wicked, alien @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.wxBQsGLdti2xcGVT]{Neothelids} impregnate themselves through ritualistic magic to produce wormlike servitor creatures called seugathis. These creatures spawn with a strong psychic drive to complete some task on behalf of the neothelids' far-reaching plans. These directives are diverse, strange, and usually cruel toward humanoid life.

weapon->Longsword.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.LJdbVTOZog39EEbi]

Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

action->Command Confusion.name: Command Confusion
action->Command Confusion.description:
Trigger A creature fails its save against the seugathi's mindfog aura

Effect The seugathi determines who the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} creature attacks for that round, instead of the target being randomly determined by the GM.

If the chosen target is the confused creature's ally, the creature can immediately attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save; on a success, its target is determined randomly as normal for confusion, and on a critical success the target is no longer confused.

action->Mindfog Aura.name: Mindfog Aura
action->Mindfog Aura.description: 20 feet. A creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round; on a success, that creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute. A seugathi can suppress or activate this aura as a single action with the concentrate trait.

action->Envenom Weapon.name: Envenom Weapon
action->Envenom Weapon.description: The seugathi applies their seugathi venom to one weapon they wield.

action->Magic Item Mastery.name: Magic Item Mastery
action->Magic Item Mastery.description: A seugathi can Cast a Spell from a magic item even if the spell isn't on their spell list. All such spells are occult spells and use the seugathi's innate spell DC and attack modifier.

action->Seugathi Venom.name: Seugathi Venom
action->Seugathi Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Seugathi Reality Warper.name: Seugathi-Realitätsverzerrer
Seugathi Reality Warper.publicNotes:
Seugathi-Realitätsverzerrer erschaffen und zerstören ungastliche Umgebungen im kleinen Maßstab, indem sie die Kräfte des reinen Chaos nutzen. Ein Neothelid könnte einen derartigen Seugathi erschaffen, um für einmalige Sklaven oder Gäste Lebensräume zu erschaffen, oder um das Ökosystem einer störenden Spezies zu zerstören. Gelehrte der Finsterlande bezeichnen Realitätsverzerrer als Veteranen in den Seugathireihen, aber genauer betrachtet gleichen sie eher aggressiven Landschaftsarchitekten.

Die boshaften, außergolarischen @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.wxBQsGLdti2xcGVT]{Neotheliden} befruchten sich mittels ritueller Magie, um wurmartige Dienerkreaturen zu erzeugen, die als Seugathis bezeichnet werden. Diese Kreaturen kommen mit einem starken psychischen Antrieb zur Welt, eine Aufgabe seitens der weitreichenden Pläne der Neotheliden zu erfüllen. Diese Anweisungen sind breitgefächert, seltsam und für gewöhnlich grausam für humanoide Lebewesen.

action->Command Confusion.name: Verwirrten befehligen
action->Command Confusion.description:
Auslöser Einer Kreatur misslingt der Rettungswurf gegen die Geistesnebelaura des Seugathis

Effekt Der Seugathi bestimmt, wen die @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Verwirrte} Kreatur in dieser Runde angreift, statt das Ziel durch den SL zufällig zu bestimmen. Falls das ausgewählte Ziel ein Verbündeter der verwirrten Kreatur ist, darf die Kreatur sofort einen @Check[type:will|dc:25]{Willenswurf} durchführen. Bei einem Erfolg wird das Ziel zufällig bestimmt, wie bei Verwirrung üblich, und bei einem Kritischen Erfolg ist die Kreatur nicht länger verwirrt.

action->Mindfog Aura.name: Geistesnebelaura
action->Mindfog Aura.description: 20 Fuß/6 m. Eine Kreatur, die ihren Zug in der Aura beginnt, muss einen @Check[type:will|dc:25]{Willenswurf} ablegen; bei Misslingen erhält für 1 Runde den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Verwirrt}; bei einem Erfolg ist die Kreatur für 1 Minute vorübergehend immun. Ein Seugathi kann diese Aura mit einer einzelnen Aktion der Kategorie Konzentration unterdrücken oder aktiveren.

action->Envenom Weapon.name: Waffe vergiften
action->Envenom Weapon.description: Der Seugathi wendet sein Seugathigift auf eine Waffe an, die er führt.

action->Magic Item Mastery.name: Magische Gegenstandsmeisterschaft
action->Magic Item Mastery.description: Ein Seugathi kann mittels magischer Gegenstände auch Zauber wirken, die nicht seiner Zauberliste stehen. Alle solche Zauber gelten als okkulte Zauber, nutzen den immanenten Zauber-SG und den Angriffsmodifikator des Seugathis.

action->Seugathi Venom.name: Seugathigift
action->Seugathi Venom.description:
Rettungswurf @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]{Zähigkeitswurf}

Maximale Wirkungsdauer 6 Runden

Phase 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]]{1W6 Giftschaden} und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Benommen 1} (1 Runde)

Phase 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]]2W6 Giftschaden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Taub} und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Benommen 2} (1 Runde).

action->Warp Reality.name: Realitätsverzerrung
action->Warp Reality.description: Der Seugathi beugt die Realität nach seiner Wahl in einer @Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 Fuß/3 m-Ausstrahlung} oder einer @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60 Fuß/18 m-Linie}, um im Wirkungsbereich das Gelände zu verändern. Nach Wahl des Seugathis ändert sich das Gelände zu einer anderen Art (beispielsweise Aquatisch, Arktisch oder Wüste) und wird dabei entweder zu normalem oder schwierigem Gelände. Bauwerke, allgemeine geographische Merkmale und Kreaturen werden in dem Gebiet nicht verwandelt, aber Kreaturen im Wirkungsbereich nehmen @Damage[5d6[spirit]]{5W6 Seelenschaden} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|basic:true]{einfacher ZÄH}), da die Realität versucht sie zusammen mit dem Gelände zu beugen. Auch wenn die Änderungen im Wirkungsbereich dauerhaft sind, könnte die natürliche Umgebung das Land irgendwann wieder in seinen Urzustand zurückversetzen (aquatische Bereiche trocknen aus, arktische Gebiete schmelzen, etc.)

Seugathi Servant.name: Seugathi-Diener
Seugathi Servant.publicNotes:
Die häufigsten Seugathis, die von den Neotheliden hervorgebracht werden, sind Seugathi-Diener. Ihre Meister rüsten sie mit Gegenständen aus, die für ihre Aufgaben nützlich sind (meistens ein Zauberstab und eine Waffe). Nur selten schätzen sie andere materielle Dinge, wenn deren Nützlichkeit über das Erfüllen ihrer aufgestempelten Mission hinausgeht.

Die boshaften, außergolarischen @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.wxBQsGLdti2xcGVT]{Neotheliden} befruchten sich mittels ritueller Magie, um wurmartige Dienerkreaturen zu erzeugen, die als Seugathis bezeichnet werden. Diese Kreaturen kommen mit einem starken psychischen Antrieb zur Welt, eine Aufgabe seitens der weitreichenden Pläne der Neotheliden zu erfüllen. Diese Anweisungen sind breitgefächert, seltsam und für gewöhnlich grausam für humanoide Lebewesen.

Shanrigol Behemoth.name: Schanrigol-Behemoth
Shanrigol Behemoth.publicNotes:
Schanrigole, die durch Aufnahme von vielen lebenden Kreatur gewachsen sind, können wirklich riesige Ausmaße annehmen und stellen in ihrem ausgedehnten Jagdgebiet eine ernste Gefahr dar. Unterirdische Gemeinschaften haben deshalb ganze Tunnel zum Einsturz gebracht, um zu verhindern, dass diese Kreaturen ihre Siedlungen erreichen.

Viele Schanrigol-Behemonths absorbieren genug Gehirnmasse, um eine grobe Intelligenz zu bilden und eine schlangenartige oder humanoide Gestalt anzunehmen. Ihr Können ist breiter als das der Schanrigol-Haufen, da sie oft Fähigkeiten von den Kreaturen erhalten, aus denen sie sich bilden. Der unten abgebildete Schanrigol-Behemoth enthält Fleisch von Drinnen und Urdefahnen, wodurch er die Fähigkeiten Netzangriff und Nekrotischer Verfall erhält. Nicht alle Schanrigol-Behmoths haben diese beiden Fähigkeiten, sollten dann aber andere Ersatz-Fähigkeiten haben.

Fleischformer, egal welcher Herkunft oder Ausbildung, erzeugen eine entsetzliche Menge an Abfall. Wenn die weggeworfenen Überreste anormalen Fleisches mit einer unbeabsichtigten Mischung alchemistischer Verbindungen oder abscheulicher Energie zusammengebracht werden, kann die Masse angeregt und zum Leben wiedererweckt werden. Ohne durch einen Fleischformer gelenkt zu werden, bilden diesen abnormalen Körperteile einen Schanrigol, ein Durcheinander an Beinen, Muskeln und Sehnen.

action->Necrotic Decay.name: Nekrotischer Verfall
action->Necrotic Decay.description: Wenn ein Schanrigol-Behemoth stirbt, verfault sein Fleisch und wandelt sich zu einem verdorben riechenden Gas, das sich in einem Wirkungsbereich einer @Template[type:emanation|distance:5]{Ausstrahlung von 5 Fuß/1,50 m} Radius um den Leichnam ausbreitet. Das Gas fügt Kreaturen innerhalb des Wirkungsbereiches @Damage[9d6[void]]{9W6 Leerenschaden} zu, während ihr Fleisch langsam gerinnt und ebenfalls beginnt zu verrotten (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:27|basic:true]{einfacher ZÄH}).

action->Sapping Squeeze.name: Zehrendes Quetschen
action->Sapping Squeeze.description:
Anforderungen Der Schanrigol hat eine Kreatur in den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Gegriffen} versetzt

Effekt Der Schanrigol quetscht das Leben aus dem Ziel und fügt ihm @Damage[(1d10+11)[bludgeoning],1d6[bleed]]{1W10+11 Wuchtschaden und 1W6 Blutungsschaden} zu (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true]{einfacher ZÄH}). Der Schanrigol erhält Temporäre Trefferpunkte in Höhe des halben Wuchtschadens hinzu, den ein einzelnes Ziel nimmt. Diese temporären Trefferpunkte bleiben 1 Minute lang bestehen.

action->Shred Flesh.name: Fleisch zerfetzen
action->Shred Flesh.description: Die Angriffe eines Schanrigol-Behemoths reißen dem Gegner brutal Fleisch heraus. Kreaturen, die vom Schanrigolangriff Fleischiger Schlag getroffen werden, erleiden zusätzlich @Damage[2d6[bleed]]{2W6 Punkte Blutungsschaden} und erhalten den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 1}, so lange sie bluten.

action->Undulating Step.name: Wogender Schritt
action->Undulating Step.description: Der Schanrigol trennt sein Fleisch von den Knochen, um durch kleine Bereiche zu schlüpfen. Wenn er sich so fortbewegt, ignoriert er dabei Schwieriges Gelände und kann sich durch enge Bereiche zwängen, als sei es eine Winzige Kreatur. Er kann keine andere Aktion als den Wogender Schritt nutzen, solange er nicht einen Bereich einnimmt, der für seine normale Gestalt groß genug ist.

action->Web Trap.name: Netzfalle
action->Web Trap.description: Eine Kreatur, die vom Netzangriff des Schanrigol-Behemoths getroffen wird, erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Bewegungsunfähig} und klebt an der nächsten Oberfläche bis ihr ein Wurf zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Entkommen} gegen SG 25 gelingt.

Shanrigol Heap.name: Schanrigol-Haufen
Shanrigol Heap.publicNotes:
Die einfachste und bekannteste Art eines Schanrigol wird Schanrigol-Haufen genannt, wegen seiner grundsätzlichen Gestalt. Diese Verbindungen von verdrehtem Fleisch und zertrümmerten Knochen etablieren ihre Jagdgründe eher zufällig als geplant. Sie bleiben dort, wo es in der Vergangenheit reichlich Beute gab, so dass sie immer fetter werden können. Nur selten erschaffen Fleischformer solche Abscheulichkeiten freiwillig, da diese alle Befehle und Eingrenzungen ignorieren, um Beute zu suchen.

Fleischformer, egal welcher Herkunft oder Ausbildung, erzeugen eine entsetzliche Menge an Abfall. Wenn die weggeworfenen Überreste anormalen Fleisches mit einer unbeabsichtigten Mischung alchemistischer Verbindungen oder abscheulicher Energie zusammengebracht werden, kann die Masse angeregt und zum Leben wiedererweckt werden. Ohne durch einen Fleischformer gelenkt zu werden, bilden diesen abnormalen Körperteile einen Schanrigol, ein Durcheinander an Beinen, Muskeln und Sehnen.

action->Sapping Squeeze.name: Zehrendes Quetschen
action->Sapping Squeeze.description:
Anforderungen Der Schanrigol hat eine Kreatur in den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Gegriffen} versetzt

Effekt Der Schanrigol quetscht das Leben aus dem Ziel und fügt ihm @Damage[(1d6+5)[bludgeoning],1d4[bleed]]{1W6+5 Wuchtschaden und 1W4 Blutungsschaden} zu (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:18|basic:true]{einfacher ZÄH}). Der Schanrigol erhält Temporäre Trefferpunkte in Höhe des halben Wuchtschadens hinzu, den ein einzelnes Ziel nimmt. Diese temporären Trefferpunkte bleiben 1 Minute lang bestehen.

action->Shred Flesh.name: Fleisch zerfetzen
action->Shred Flesh.description: Der Schanrigol fetzt dem Ziel in großen Tranchen Fleisch heraus. Kreaturen, die vom Schanrigolangriff Fleischiger Schlag Kritisch getroffen werden, erleiden zusätzlich @Damage[1d6[bleed]]{1W6 Punkte Blutungsschaden} und erhalten den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 1}, so lange sie bluten.

action->Undulating Step.name: Wogender Schritt
action->Undulating Step.description: Der Schanrigol trennt sein Fleisch von den Knochen, um durch kleine Bereiche zu schlüpfen. Wenn er sich so fortbewegt, ignoriert er dabei Schwieriges Gelände und kann sich durch enge Bereiche zwängen, als sei es eine Winzige Kreatur. Er kann keine andere Aktion als den Wogender Schritt nutzen, solange er nicht einen Bereich einnimmt, der für seine normale Gestalt groß genug ist.

Shuffling Scythe Blades.name: Shuffling Scythe Blades
Shuffling Scythe Blades.description: Six long blades, hidden in grooves in the walls and floor, zigzag through different parts of this hallway when any pressure plate in the hallway intersection is depressed; there are so many plates it's impossible to avoid them when moving through the room. The blades retreat into the floor and move through the hidden grooves before swinging out from the wall again in a different location.
Shuffling Scythe Blades.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:26|name:Disable Each Blade] (expert) to disable each blade, or utter the magical passphrase (which only Chafkhem knows) to deactivate the trap for 10 minutes
Shuffling Scythe Blades.reset: The trap resets when no creatures remain in area B20. Damaged or destroyed blades aren't repaired when the trap resets.
Shuffling Scythe Blades.routine: (7 actions) The trap spends 1 action for each of its blades; a blade makes a scythe Strike against each creature in its region. With its final action, the trap uses Scythe Shuffle. Reduce the number of actions the trap can take by 1 for each destroyed blade.

action->Dicing Scythes.name: Dicing Scythes
action->Dicing Scythes.description:
Trigger A creature steps in the 15-footby-25-foot area where the branching hallways connect

Effect The trap uses Scythe Shuffle; each blade makes a scythe Strike against each creature in its region, then it uses Scythe Shuffle again. The trap then rolls for initiative.

action->Scythe Shuffle.name: Scythe Shuffle
action->Scythe Shuffle.description:
The blades travel erratically throughout the hallway's branches, out of sight under the floors or behind the walls. For each blade, roll [[/br 1d4 #Direction Scythe Blade]]{1d4} to determine the region in which it next makes scythe Strikes. A creature can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} (@Check[type:perception|dc:22|traits:action:seek]) to learn clues about blades in the region they're currently occupying. On a success, the creature knows how many blades are currently in its region.

1. Main intersection (the 15-foot-by-25-foot area where the hallways connect, as marked on area B20)

2. North branch (from the main intersection to the secret door to area B14)

3. Central hall (from the main intersection to the secret door to area B24)

4. South branch (from the main intersection to the wall shared with area B25)

strike-melee->Scythe.name: Scythe
strike-melee->Scythe.description: No MAP applies to strikes made by scythe attacks

action->No MAP.name: No MAP
action->No MAP.description: The Scythe Strikes do not apply a MAP.

Siora Fallowglade.name: Siora Fallowglade
Siora Fallowglade.publicNotes:
Shadows that spend long amounts of time on the Shadow Plane and absorb its magic become greater shadows.

The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light. Those who parley with shadows, typically by keeping them at bay with a glowing weapon, may learn great secrets, for they are ideal spies.

spell->Darkness (At Will).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]
Darkness (At Will)

action->Light Vulnerability.name: Light Vulnerability
action->Light Vulnerability.description: An object shedding magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell) is treated as magical when used to attack the shadow.

action->Mark for Death.name: Mark for Death
action->Mark for Death.description:
Requirements Siora can see the target she intends to mark

Effect Siora designates a single target as her mark. She gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} her target, and her spectral hand Strikes against her target gain the deadly d8 weapon trait.

action->Shadow Spawn.name: Shadow Spawn
action->Shadow Spawn.description: When a creature's shadow is pulled free by Steal Shadow, it becomes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.XrmHgbKgcHDi4OnK]{Shadow Spawn} under the command of the shadow that created it. This shadow spawn doesn't have Steal Shadow. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous shadow. If the creature recovers from its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeeblement}, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.

action->Slink in Shadows.name: Slink in Shadows
action->Slink in Shadows.description: The shadow can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

action->Steal Shadow.name: Steal Shadow
action->Steal Shadow.description:
Requirement The shadow hit a living creature with a shadow hand Strike on its previous action.

Effect The shadow pulls at the target's shadow, making the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} on a critical hit). This is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from shadows, to a maximum of enfeebled 4. If this increases a creature's enfeebled value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is separated from its body. Enfeebled from Steal Shadow decreases by 1 every hour.

Spellvoid.name: Spellvoid
Spellvoid.publicNotes:
Malevolent balls of colored light, will-o'-wisps haunt lonely marshes and forests where they lure unsuspecting travelers into danger. Will-o'-wisps can vary the color and illumination they shed, and delight in mimicking bobbing lanterns or distant fires to draw lost or disoriented travelers off of safe trails. They can extinguish their illumination entirely to become invisible, and they enjoy doing so once their victims are wholly lost and have realized that the bobbing light in the distance isn't, in fact, leading them to safety. Even invisible, however, a will-o'-wisp rarely ventures far from its target, as it feasts upon the panic and dread felt by its victims.

Beneath its glow, a will-o'-wisp's body is a spongy ball approximately 1 foot in diameter and weighing less than 5 pounds. Although most will-o'-wisps are merely translucent, featureless orbs, gaining definition only in the shifting illumination they create, a few have dark mottling that makes them resemble a skull when viewed closely. Will-o'-wisps have no need for mundane nourishment, and in fact lack the ability to consume matter of any kind; they find all the sustenance they need in the terror of nearby creatures. For this reason, they like to work alongside undead that produce terror in their victims. Will-o'-wisps are long-lived, if not effectively immortal, and they have good memories. A cowed or defeated will-o'-wisp can be a good source of lore and information, though acquiring such cooperation from such a sinister monster is no easy feat.

Will-o'-wisps inhabit desolate swamps and forests and are generally active at twilight and after dark. They are therefore reluctant to lead victims into immediately fatal areas such as deadfalls, but instead prefer hazards where their victims suffer over a long time, such as pockets of stale or poisonous air, patches of quicksand, and dens of bigger monsters. According to will-o'-wisps, different types of fear have subtle differences in flavor. The lurking dread in the pit of the stomach that gnaws at those who slowly become aware of the fact that they're lost produces a much different taste than the sudden stark terror of imminent death in the face of a towering monster. Because of this, will-o'-wisps try to vary the ways in which they induce terror in their prey, to ensure they don't tire of certain flavors of fear.

Feeding not on fear but on the ephemeral potentiality of magic lodged in the minds of their victims, these will-o'-wisps are a bane to casters of all types. They usually leave non-spellcasters alone and sometimes follow adventuring groups without spellcasters on the hope of being led to creatures they find more appetizing.

action->Glow.name: Glow
action->Glow.description: 20 feet. A will-o'-wisp is itself naturally invisible, but glows with a colored light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.

action->Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
action->Magic Immunity.description: A will-o'-wisp is immune to all spells except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}.

action->Feed on Magic.name: Feed on Magic
action->Feed on Magic.description:
Requirement A creature who can cast spells is within 15 feet of the spellvoid

Effect The spellvoid feeds on the creature's magic. The spellvoid regains [[/r 2d8[healing]]] Hit Points, and the target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:24] save.

The target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The first time the target Casts a Spell before the start of the spellvoid's next turn, the spell is disrupted unless the target succeeds at a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] check.

Failure As success, but the effect applies the first time the target Casts a Spell within the next minute.

Critical Failure As success, but the effect applies each time the target Casts a Spell within the next minute. In addition, the spellvoid doubles the Hit Points it regains.

action->Go Dark.name: Go Dark
action->Go Dark.description: The will-o'-wisp extinguishes its glow, becoming invisible. It can end this effect with another use of this action. If it uses its shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine its location, making the will-o'-wisp only hidden to all observers until it moves.

Spike Launcher.name: Spike Launcher
Spike Launcher.description: A jagged spike of metal shoots from a hidden launcher.
Spike Launcher.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:16|name:Disable Launcher|traits:mechanical,trap] to disable one of the four launchers or @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:12|name:Avoid Trip Line|traits:mechanical,trap] to step over a trip line (this doesn't disarm the trap, but avoids triggering it)

action->Spike.name: Spike
action->Spike.description:
Trigger A creature crosses one of the trip lines

Effect A spike launches along the trip line's path against the triggering creature, making a ranged Strike.

Stonescale Spirits.name: Stonescale Spirits
Stonescale Spirits.description: A half-dozen ghostly kobolds rise from the rubble in a howling vortex.
Stonescale Spirits.disable: @Check[type:intimidation|dc:18|name:Frighten the Spirits] (trained) to frighten the spirits with a threatening display, or @Check[type:religion|dc:21|name:Excorcise the Spirits] (trained) to exorcise the spirits
Stonescale Spirits.reset:
The haunt deactivates if there are no frightened creatures in area A7 at the start of its turn. The ghostly kobolds return to the rubble pile.

The haunt can't activate again for 1 hour.
Stonescale Spirits.routine: (1 action) The spirits swoop together toward one creature in area A7 who's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, instilling feelings of betrayal and confusion. The target takes @Damage[(1d10+4)[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:18|basic:true] save).

action->Confusing Confrontation.name: Confusing Confrontation
action->Confusing Confrontation.description:
Trigger A creature enters a square either fully or partially filled with rubble in the middle of the room

Effect Six ghostly kobolds surge out of the rubble with eerie yowls. Each creature in area A7 must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save with the following results. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected, is temporarily immune to Confusing Confrontation for 24 hours, and realizes that a display of intimidating dominance might quell the ghostly kobolds' assault.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 2 rounds and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Summoning Chamber Erinys.name: Summoning Chamber Erinys
Summoning Chamber Erinys.publicNotes:
Erinyes exact vengeance and bloody justice for a creature's crimes, torturing and punishing their victims in ironic fashion before allowing them the escape of death. While an erinys appears as a fallen angel and the first erinyes shared that origin, erinyes now originate in myriad ways, some promoted from lesser devils and others shaped from lemures themselves forged from the souls of torturers and persecutors. The erinyes' origin is entwined with Eiseth, herself a fallen angel and one of Hell's most powerful demigods. The first erinyes were all considered to be Eiseth's metaphorical daughters, but erinyes formed since that time are no longer limited to a single gender.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks. Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly lemures and imps perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as contract devils and erinyes, while the greatest pit fiends command entire infernal armies.

spell->Fear (At Will).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]
Fear (At Will)

spell->Illusory Disguise (At Will).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]
Illusory Disguise (At Will)

weapon->Longsword.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.LJdbVTOZog39EEbi]

Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

armor->Breastplate.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.r0ifJfoz8aqf0mwk]

Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

equipment->100 feet of Erinys-Hair Rope.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.fyYnQf1NAx9fWFaS]
100 feet of Erinys-Hair Rope
equipment->100 feet of Erinys-Hair Rope.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.fyYnQf1NAx9fWFaS]

100 feet of rope.

action->Telepathy 100 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]
Telepathy 100 feet

action->Flames of Fury.name: Flames of Fury
action->Flames of Fury.description: Any weapon an erinys holds gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} rune while they hold it.

action->Furious Fusillade.name: Furious Fusillade
action->Furious Fusillade.description: The erinys hovers in place if they are flying and fires one arrow at any number of creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Each attack is rolled separately. This counts as one attack for the purpose of the erinys's multiple attack penalty.

action->Rope Snare.name: Rope Snare
action->Rope Snare.description:
An erinys carries a coil of rope woven of their hair (use the statistics for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.fyYnQf1NAx9fWFaS]{Rope}) that animates in their hands.

When a creature is hit by the erinys's rope, a segment of the rope tears loose and wraps itself around the creature, imposing a 10-foot circumstance penalty to Speed. The piece that tears off is 10 feet long for a Medium or smaller creature, and doubles in length for each size larger than Medium.

When a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} the effect (DC 26), the detached segment of rope withers away into useless black sludge.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.o0zqsH5kYopRanav]{Effect: Rope Snare}

Torture Chamber Barbazu.name: Torture Chamber Barbazu
Torture Chamber Barbazu.publicNotes:
Barbazus, known also as bearded devils or infantry devils, are murderous fiends who satiate their lust for annihilation by serving as the foot soldiers of Hell's armies, often leading hordes of lesser devils such as imps and lemures into battle. Bearded devils wield serrated glaives to inflict jagged gashes that resist healing magic, resulting in tremendous blood loss. When enemies come too close, bearded devils strike with the spines of their wriggling beards to deliver a wretched contagion called Avernal fever, savoring the sight of their victim's strength being slowly devoured from within.

Barbazus can be found savagely indulging the whims of evil infernal lords from all layers of Hell, rejoicing as they disseminate murder, misery, and anguish as they see fit.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks. Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly lemures and imps perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as contract devils and erinyes, while the greatest pit fiends command entire infernal armies.

weapon->Hellforged Glaive.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.vlnzTSsRmWeSkt9O]
Hellforged Glaive

action->Telepathy 100 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]
Telepathy 100 feet

action->Avernal Fever.name: Avernal Fever
action->Avernal Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

action->Infernal Wound.name: Infernal Wound
action->Infernal Wound.description:
A bearded devil's glaive Strike also deals @Damage[1d6[bleed]] that resists attempts to heal it.

The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at @Check[type:flat|dc:20]. The DC is reduced to @Check[type:flat|dc:15] only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 5.

A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 21 counteract check or the magic fails to heal the creature.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.inLBsuLRE5xmVHdn]{Effect: Infernal Wound}

action->Reposition.name: Reposition
action->Reposition.description:
Trigger The devil hits a creature with a glaive Strike.

Effect The devil moves the creature 5 feet in any direction. The destination square must be within reach of the devil's glaive.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Wriggling Beard.name: Wriggling Beard
action->Wriggling Beard.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect The barbazu makes a beard Strike. This Strike ignores their multiple attack penalty and doesn't count toward that penalty.

Urdefhan Blood Mage.name: Urdefhan Blood Mage
Urdefhan Blood Mage.publicNotes:
Hardened masters of occult power, urdefhan blood mages trade their blood for magical might. A heavily scarred blood mage is held in esteem by their fellow urdefhans, as it shows they have survived many bargains with eerie occult patrons.

Translucent-skinned scourges of the Darklands, urdefhans are remorseless killers and foot soldiers of the world's end.

action->Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
action->Necrotic Decay.description:
When an urdefhan dies, its invisible flesh quickly rots away and sublimates into a foul-smelling gas that fills a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] around the body.

This gas deals @Damage[8d6[void]] damage to creatures in this area as their flesh curdles and rots as well (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:24|basic:true] save).

action->Blood Offering.name: Blood Offering
action->Blood Offering.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The blood mage cuts themself and takes @Damage[8[slashing]] damage. If the blood mage's next action is to Cast a Spell, the action can't be disrupted, and if the spell has a range, the blood mage can increase that spell's range by 30 feet.

action->Wicked Bite.name: Wicked Bite
action->Wicked Bite.description:
Requirements The urdefhan damaged a creature with a jaws Strike on its last action

Effect The urdefhan maintains contact, turning the creature's flesh translucent around the site of the injury. The urdefhan chooses one of two options, each of which requires a fortitude save. If the jaws Strike was a critical hit, the creature suffers both effects, using the same save result for both.

  • Drain Blood @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] The urdefhan drinks some of the creature's blood. On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the urdefhan regains [[/r 10[healing]]]{10 HP} (or, on a critical failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the urdefhan regains [[/r 20[healing]]]{20 HP}).
  • Drain Vitality (necromancy) @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|traits:necromancy] The urdefhan draws out some of the creature's vital essence. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour on a failed save (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour on a critical failure).

Urdefhan Death Scout.name: Urdefhan Death Scout
Urdefhan Death Scout.publicNotes:
Death scouts train as spies and assassins for their cult. Other urdefhans scorn their stealthy methods, but none can argue with their results.

Translucent-skinned scourges of the Darklands, urdefhans are remorseless killers and foot soldiers of the world's end.

Urdefhan Lasher.name: Urdefhan Lasher
Urdefhan Lasher.publicNotes:
Trained from a young age with the strange and powerful shauth lashes, urdefhan lashers would rather die than retreat from combat.

Translucent-skinned scourges of the Darklands, urdefhans are remorseless killers and foot soldiers of the world's end.

action->Distracting Declaration.name: Distracting Declaration
action->Distracting Declaration.description: Urevian keeps a few sly words at the ready to distract enemies. He always uses Deception for initiative.

action->Ward Contract.name: Ward Contract
action->Ward Contract.description: Any signed contract Urevian carries (including any draped over his horns) is immune to damage from creatures other than Urevian. In addition, Urevian is immune to mental effects that would make him alter, nullify, or destroy a contract.

action->Draft Contract.name: Draft Contract
action->Draft Contract.description:
Urevian produces an infernal contract for a single living mortal. This contract can grant a wide range of abilities and effects, akin to the power of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} spell but fulfilled to the letter by Urevian. To receive any of those benefits, the mortal must willingly sign its true name to the contract. At that point, the mortal's soul is bound to Urevian and to Hell.

While the contract is in effect, the mortal can't be restored to life except by wish or similar magic. If the mortal is restored to life by those means, Urevian knows which mortal came to life and can locate the creature or creatures who restored the mortal to life for 1 year, gaining the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LQzlKbYjZSMFQawP]{Locate} spell with unlimited range. Avoiding the terms of an infernal contract is difficult and often dangerous.

action->Infernal Wound.name: Infernal Wound
action->Infernal Wound.description:
Urevian's Strikes also deal @Damage[2d6[bleed]] that resists attempts to heal them.

The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at @Check[type:flat|dc:20]. The DC is reduced to @Check[type:flat|dc:15] only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 5.

A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 28 counteract check or the magic fails to heal the creature.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.inLBsuLRE5xmVHdn]{Effect: Infernal Wound}

action->Right of Inspection.name: Right of Inspection
action->Right of Inspection.description: Urevian can cast his innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r784cIz17eWujtQj]{Scrying} spell at will, but only to target a creature with which he has a contract, a specific creature named in a contract he has, or a descendant of any of those creatures. The outcome of the target's saving throw is one step worse than the result it rolled.

Urthagul.name: Urthagul
Urthagul.publicNotes:
A gug's most horrid feature is its barrel-shaped head, which splits vertically to reveal numerous rows of sharp, yellow teeth and an open throat. Its eyes on either side of its head-jaw are small but keen. Bony ridges protect its eyes from the frantic flailing of its prey, as it prefers meals of raw and writhing meat over fungi and molds. It grips said prey with powerful arms that split at the elbow into a pair of forearms, giving it four clawed paws. These monstrous brutes are covered with shaggy black fur, often crusted with blood and gore.

Although gugs may seem bestial, they have keen and wicked intellects. Gugs lair far underground, but they sometimes come to the surface to hunt during dark nights, either alone or in small groups. As they possess voracious appetites, most gugs consume the creatures they catch, but some instead kidnap their victims and retreat below the surface, leaving only a lingering stench and odd, clawed paw-prints. Victims are taken to rancid lairs marked with strange runes and sacrificed to the gugs' wicked gods of blood, darkness, and nightmares. Dire rumors tell of lightless gug cities made of titanic blocks of stone far underground, where powerful gug leaders preach their vile doctrines to mobs of howling gugs.

Gugs have a strange relationship with ghouls, which seems to date from their shared origin in a distant subterranean world. Gugs live in fear of ghouls, despite towering over them; however, this strange fear doesn't apply to ghasts, whom gugs consume as voraciously as they do other creatures.

Gugs stand 16 feet tall and weigh 2,000 pounds, although they have an eerie, graceful gait that belies their immense size. Their light step and ability to squeeze through very small crannies makes gugs common bogeymen in tales of strange disappearances or bloody massacres.

Some particularly bloodthirsty gugs gain awful powers as gifts from their eldritch patrons. These monsters are known as savants, are never less than 12th level in power, and gain several occult innate spells. Though each savant's precise mix of spells varies, normally, these spells grant invisibility, offer power to manipulate and change rock, or invoke awful and destructive energies upon living flesh.

action->Eerie Flexibility.name: Eerie Flexibility
action->Eerie Flexibility.description: Despite its size, the gug's multiple joints allow it to fit through tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing}, it can move at its full Speed.

action->Furious Claws.name: Furious Claws
action->Furious Claws.description: The gug makes up to four claw Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks all count toward the gug's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the gug makes all its attacks.

action->Rend.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.3JOi2cMcGhT3eze1]

Claw

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Rend]

Vengeful Furnace.name: Vengeful Furnace
Vengeful Furnace.description: The hatch atop the haunted furnace flips open and disgorges a pair of shrieking, burning ghosts.
Vengeful Furnace.disable: @Check[type:intimidation|dc:22|name:Cow a Spirit] (trained) to cow one of the vengeful spirits or @Check[type:religion|dc:25|name:Exorcise the Spirit] (trained) to exorcise the spirit. The haunt remains active until both spirits are cowed or exorcised, or until the furnace is destroyed.
Vengeful Furnace.reset: The haunt resets 1 hour after there are no creatures in the room.
Vengeful Furnace.routine: (3 actions) The burning ghosts lash at a random @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied} creature in the room (or any random creature, if no creatures in the room are stupefied).

action->Burn Knowledge.name: Burn Knowledge
action->Burn Knowledge.description:
The target of the haunt's initial Ghostly Assault, as well as any creature later hit by a burning lash Strike, loses random memories, as if these thoughts were incinerated like pages in a burning book.

The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:23] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute while they forget random memories, as if these thoughts were incinerated like pages in a burning book.

Failure As success, but the stupefied 1 condition persists for 24 hours.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

action->Ghostly Assault.name: Ghostly Assault
action->Ghostly Assault.description:
Trigger A living creature with an Intelligence score of 15 or higher enters the room, or any creature touches the furnace

Effect Burning ghosts burst from the furnace, exposing the triggering creature to the haunt's burn knowledge effect. The haunt rolls initiative.

action->Immobilizing Blow.name: Immobilizing Blow
action->Immobilizing Blow.description:
Vischari makes a fist Strike that shuts down her target's motor control. The target must make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save. If the Strike was a critical hit, treat the target's save result as one degree worse. The target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is paralyzed for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a new Fortitude save to reduce the remaining duration by 1 round or end it entirely on a critical success.

action->Wicked Bite.name: Wicked Bite
action->Wicked Bite.description:
Requirements Vischari damaged a creature with a jaws Strike on her last action

Effect Vischari maintains contact, turning the creature's flesh translucent around the site of the injury. Vischari chooses one of two options, each of which requires the target to attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save. If her jaws Strike was a critical hit, the creature suffers both effects, using the same save result for both.

  • Drain Blood Vischari drinks some of the creature's blood. On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and Vischari regains [[/r 10[healing]]]{10 HP} (on a critical failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and Vischari regains [[/r 20[healing]]]{20 HP}).
  • Drain Vitality Vischari draws out some of the creature's vital essence. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour on a failed save (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour on a critical failure).

Viscous Black Pudding.name: Viscous Black Pudding
Viscous Black Pudding.publicNotes:
Most often found below ground, these oozes scour caves for objects to dissolve with their corrosive secretions. This caustic acid is particularly dangerous to creatures that attack a pudding, as it can quickly damage and destroy gear.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

action->Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
action->Motion Sense 60 feet.description: A black pudding can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->Adjust Shape.name: Adjust Shape
action->Adjust Shape.description: A viscous black pudding is thicker than most black puddings and can heap its body upon itself or spread itself out again. The pudding changes its size to Medium, Large, or Huge. If the pudding is Medium, its density reduces its Speeds to 10 feet, but this ability doesn't otherwise change its Strikes or its Speed. If the viscous black pudding Splits, both of the new puddings have the same size as it had at that time, until they Adjust their Shape.

action->Corrosive Mass.name: Corrosive Mass
action->Corrosive Mass.description: A creature that hits the pudding with a metal or wooden weapon must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:22] save or the weapon takes @Damage[2d6[acid]] damage (after dealing damage to the black pudding as normal). Thrown weapons and ammunition take this damage automatically with no save.

action->Split.name: Split
action->Split.description:
When the black pudding is hit by an attack that would deal slashing or piercing damage and has 10 or more HP, it splits into two identical puddings, each with half the original's HP.

One pudding is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, it automatically pushes creatures and objects out of the way to fill a space (the GM decides if an object or creature is too big or sturdy to push).

action->Corrosive Touch.name: Corrosive Touch
action->Corrosive Touch.description: When the pudding hits a creature with its pseudopod, any acid damage is dealt to the creature's armor or clothing as well as the creature.

action->Suction.name: Suction
action->Suction.description: The pudding can climb on ceilings and other inverted surfaces, though such surfaces are difficult terrain for it.

action->Mind Feeding.name: Mind Feeding
action->Mind Feeding.description:
Requirements A drained creature is grabbed by the chuul's tentacles

Effect The creature takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

action->Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
action->Swamp Stride.description: The Voidbracken chuul ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain in swamps.

action->Tentacle Transfer.name: Tentacle Transfer
action->Tentacle Transfer.description:
Requirements The Voidbracken chuul has a creature grabbed

Effect The chuul transfers the grabbed creature from its claws to its tentacles, or vice versa. The creature is exposed to the chuul's draining venom when transferred into the tentacles and at the start of each of the chuul's turns if it remains grabbed by the tentacles.

Voidglutton.name: Leerenfresser
Voidglutton.publicNotes: Ein Leerenfresser ist ein mächtiger Vertreter eines Irrlichts, das an einem Platz spukt, an dem das Leid wohnt – beispielsweise ein Friedhof, Gefangenenlager oder ehemaliges Schlachtfeld. Ein Leerenfresser erscheint als brodelnde Sphäre mit glühenden Augen, die um einen leeren, schwarzen Wirbel von 4 Fuß/1,20 m Breite wirbeln. Aus dem Inneren dieses Wirbels erstrecken sich lange, halbtransparente Ranken, die zu siebenfingrigen, nadelspitzen Händen werden.

action->Glow.name: Leuchten
action->Glow.description: 30 Fuß/9 m. Die Fingerspitzen und sieben Augen des Leerenfressers leuchten, so dass es ein Helles Licht in das Gebiet abgibt und sichtbar wird, falls er @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Unsichtbar} war.

action->Consume Light.name: Licht verzehren
action->Consume Light.description:
Auslöser Der Leerenfresser wirkt @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]{Dunkelheit}

Effekt Der Leerenfresser beendet seine Fähigkeit Leuchten als Teil seines Zauberwirkens. Er wird @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Unsichtbar}, solange er sich im Wirkungsbereich seiner Dunkelheit befindet. Falls der Leerenfresser eine feindselige Handlung verwendet, endet seine Unsichtbarkeit sofort nach Beendigung dieser feindseligen Handlung.

action->Ectoplasmic Web Trap.name: Ektoplasmische Netzfalle
action->Ectoplasmic Web Trap.description: Eine Kreatur, die von der ektoplasmischen Netzfalle des Leerenfressers getroffen wird, erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Bewegungsunfähig} und haftet an der nächstgelegenen Oberfläche, bis ihr ein Fertigkeitswurf zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Entkommen} gegen SG 26 gelingt. Die Ektoplasmische Netzfalle kann körperlose Kreaturen bewegungsunfähig machen.

action->Fearful Strike.name: Furchteinflößender Schlag
action->Fearful Strike.description: Fügt der Leerenfresser einer Kreatur mit seinem Klauenangriff Schaden zu, muss die Kreatur einen @Check[type:will|dc:26]{Willenswurf} ablegen. Bei einem Misserfolg erhält die Kreatur den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Verängstigt 1} (bzw. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Verängstigt 2} bei einem Kritischen Misserfolg).

action->Feed on Fear.name: Von Furcht zehren
action->Feed on Fear.description:
Häufigkeit Einmal pro Runde

Voraussetzung Ein Gegner in einer Entfernung von bis zu 15 Fuß/4,50 m zum Leerenfresser besitzt den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Verängstigt} oder @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Sterbend}

Effekt Der Leerenfresser nährt sich am Grauen der Kreatur. Er erhält [[/r 3d4[healing]]]{3W4 Trefferpunkte} zurück und seine Fähigkeit Leuchten wirkt wieder, falls sie beendet wurde. Er kann die Fähigkeit Licht verzehren erst nach [[/br 1d4 #Runden]]{1W4 Runden} wieder nutzen, da er sich an der Furcht zu sehr überfrisst hat, um sein Leuchten zu unterdrücken.

action->Magic Immunity.name: Magische Immunität
action->Magic Immunity.description: Ein Leerenfresser ist immun gegenüber allen Zaubern mit Ausnahme von @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Feenfeuer}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Zwickmühle}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Kraftgeschoss} und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Enthüllendes Licht}.

action->Discorporate.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.QlrbnkeZu6M4kvOy]
Discorporate
action->Discorporate.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.QlrbnkeZu6M4kvOy]

Slow-moving leeches give the heroes 2 rounds, rather than 1 round, to dispatch the fleeing vermin before they escape.

When the worm that walks is reduced to 0 HP, it discorporates and the component worms that make up its body disperse in every direction. If even a single worm escapes, the worm that walks will eventually re-form using a process that typically takes [[/br 1d10 #Re-Form]]{1d10 days}.

While the exact circumstances and surroundings determine how long the worm that walks's foes have to dispatch the fleeing worms before they escape, usually its foes have only a single round.

Typically, this requires the application of an area effect or splash weapon within 1 round to the space where the worm that walks collapsed. After any amount of area or splash damage is dealt to that space, the character dealing the damage must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] check. Each subsequent area or splash damage effect performed on the area reduces the DC of this flat check by 2, to a minimum of DC 5. If any of these flat checks succeed, none of the worms escape, and the worm that walks is destroyed permanently.

At the GM's discretion, clever means of trapping or otherwise detaining the vermin may extend the time allowed to finish off the worm that walks.

action->Hateful Memories.name: Hateful Memories
action->Hateful Memories.description: If Volluk can see an accurate depiction of his former appearance as a living drow at the start of his turn, he must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:28] save or become filled with self-loathing and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

action->Squirming Embrace.name: Squirming Embrace
action->Squirming Embrace.description: Volluk Strides, ending his movement sharing a space with a creature, and deals @Damage[3d8[piercing]] damage to the creature. The creature can attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:23|basic:true] save.

action->Swarm Shape.name: Swarm Shape
action->Swarm Shape.description: Volluk collapses into a shapeless swarm of leeches. He drops all held, worn, and carried items. While discorporated, he can't use attack actions and can't cast spells, but he can move through areas small enough for his individual leeches to fit without having to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze}. He can use the same action to coalesce back into his normal form.

Warped Brew Morlock.name: Warped Brew Morlock
Warped Brew Morlock.publicNotes:
Originating from humans long lost from the world of light, morlocks are brutal monsters that dwell in the tangled tunnels of the upper reaches of the Darklands. Their wiry frames mask the strength of their limbs and their swift reactions, and their arms are long enough that they can drop into an uncanny, four-limbed shuffle for speed or stealth. They no longer remember the lives their ancestors led on the surface, although many morlocks still dwell in the shattered ruins of their ancient homes. Some morlocks worship the statues of humans from these bygone eras as gods, but others now worship Lamashtu, Rovagug, or other violent deities.

Morlock young are insatiable and clamor for even the slightest morsel of food, even consuming their siblings if no other meal presents itself. Most morlocks encourage the practice to ensure their ancestral group as a whole grows stronger.

A typical morlock stands just over 5 feet tall and weighs roughly 150 pounds.
Warped Brew Morlock.saveDetails: +2 status to all saves vs. disease and poison

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Disea.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kquBnQ0kObZztnBc]
+2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease and Poison

action->Instinctual Tinker.name: Instinctual Tinker
action->Instinctual Tinker.description:
The morlock tinkers with an adjacent construct or mechanical hazard. They attempt a @Check[type:crafting|defense:fortitude] check against the construct's or hazard's Fortitude DC. The morlock can't succeed if the target's level is more than double the morlock's.

Critical Success The target gains [[/r 4d6[healing]]] Hit Points and a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls for 1 minute.

Success The target gains [[/r 2d6[healing]]] Hit Points.

Critical Failure The morlock injures itself, taking [[/r 2d6]]{2d6 damage} (typically bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing, but potentially a different type at the GM's discretion).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TEzLEXBZzNCp6flg]{Effect: Instinctual Tinker (Critical Success)}

action->Leap Attack.name: Leap Attack
action->Leap Attack.description:
The morlock Strides up to twice its Speed, during which it attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}. At any point during its movement, the morlock can make a melee Strike against an enemy in its reach.

The morlock then can't use Leap Attack for 1 round.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

A morlock's Strikes deal an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Swarming Stance.name: Swarming Stance
action->Swarming Stance.description: A morlock can share the same space as another morlock, but no more than two morlocks can occupy the same space. When morlocks share the same space, they gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls.

Watching Wall.name: Watching Wall
Watching Wall.description: An overwhelming feeling of being watched wells up in the minds of those in the room, an instant before an eerie red eye opens in the western wall.
Watching Wall.disable: @Check[type:deception|dc:22|name:Appear Uninteresting|traits:haunt] (trained) to appear uninteresting to the watching eye (and thus be ignored by it) or @Check[type:religion|dc:22|name:Ward Against Being Seen|traits:haunt] (trained) to ward against being seen by or affected by the eye.
Watching Wall.reset: The haunt becomes inert at the end of any round in which there are no @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creatures it can see. It stays dormant for 1 hour, after which point it resets.
Watching Wall.routine:
(1 action) The eye glances about, and those it can see (whether in area C4 or outside of it) take @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:21|basic:true|traits:haunt] save) as fears of being watched impart ripples of pain.

A creature that takes mental damage from this effect doesn't reduce their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} value at the end of their next turn.

action->Someone is Watching.name: Someone is Watching
action->Someone is Watching.description:
Trigger A living creature remains in area C4 for at least 1 round

Effect An overwhelming wave of paranoia fills area C4. Each creature in the room must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save, with the following results. An eerie red eye then opens in the center of the western wall, looking about the room, and the haunt rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and feels like someone or something is watching them for as long as they remain frightened.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and treats no one as an ally as long as they remain frightened.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} as long as they remain frightened.

Will-o'-the-Deep.name: Will-o'-the-Deep
Will-o'-the-Deep.publicNotes:
Malevolent balls of colored light, will-o'-wisps haunt lonely marshes and forests where they lure unsuspecting travelers into danger. Will-o'-wisps can vary the color and illumination they shed, and delight in mimicking bobbing lanterns or distant fires to draw lost or disoriented travelers off of safe trails. They can extinguish their illumination entirely to become invisible, and they enjoy doing so once their victims are wholly lost and have realized that the bobbing light in the distance isn't, in fact, leading them to safety. Even invisible, however, a will-o'-wisp rarely ventures far from its target, as it feasts upon the panic and dread felt by its victims.

Beneath its glow, a will-o'-wisp's body is a spongy ball approximately 1 foot in diameter and weighing less than 5 pounds. Although most will-o'-wisps are merely translucent, featureless orbs, gaining definition only in the shifting illumination they create, a few have dark mottling that makes them resemble a skull when viewed closely. Will-o'-wisps have no need for mundane nourishment, and in fact lack the ability to consume matter of any kind; they find all the sustenance they need in the terror of nearby creatures. For this reason, they like to work alongside undead that produce terror in their victims. Will-o'-wisps are long-lived, if not effectively immortal, and they have good memories. A cowed or defeated will-o'-wisp can be a good source of lore and information, though acquiring such cooperation from such a sinister monster is no easy feat.

Will-o'-wisps inhabit desolate swamps and forests and are generally active at twilight and after dark. They are therefore reluctant to lead victims into immediately fatal areas such as deadfalls, but instead prefer hazards where their victims suffer over a long time, such as pockets of stale or poisonous air, patches of quicksand, and dens of bigger monsters. According to will-o'-wisps, different types of fear have subtle differences in flavor. The lurking dread in the pit of the stomach that gnaws at those who slowly become aware of the fact that they're lost produces a much different taste than the sudden stark terror of imminent death in the face of a towering monster. Because of this, will-o'-wisps try to vary the ways in which they induce terror in their prey, to ensure they don't tire of certain flavors of fear.

Aquatic will-o'-wisps, will-o'-the-deeps dwell within oceans and even terrestrial lakes, and strings of them can create profoundly beautiful vistas. Their propensity to draw ships toward reefs and whirlpools or to swarm smaller vessels makes them a deadly hazard.

action->Glow.name: Glow
action->Glow.description: 20 feet. A will-o'-wisp is itself naturally invisible, but glows with a colored light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.

action->Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
action->Magic Immunity.description: A will-o'-wisp is immune to all spells except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}.

action->Feed on Fear.name: Feed on Fear
action->Feed on Fear.description:
Requirement An enemy is under a fear effect or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} within 15 feet of the will-o'-wisp.

Effect The will-o'wisp feeds on the creature's terror. It regains [[/r 2d4[healing]]] Hit Points, and if it has Gone Dark, its glow reignites.

A will-o'-wisp can take this action only once per round.

action->Go Dark.name: Go Dark
action->Go Dark.description: The will-o'-wisp extinguishes its glow, becoming invisible. It can end this effect with another use of this action. If it uses its shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine its location, making the will-o'-wisp only hidden to all observers until it moves.

Witchfire Warden.name: Witchfire Warden
Witchfire Warden.publicNotes:
Manifesting as a sinuous form wreathed in sickly green flames, this incorporeal undead forms when a powerful hag or witch dies in agony or rage. The body at the center of the flames usually resembles the witch's idealized self-image, regardless of their age and appearance at the time of their death.

A witchfire often resides in a bog or swamp, which slowly blackens and decays around them. These regions are often plagued by will-o'-wisps, which seem to have an uncanny relationship with the resident witchfire. A witchfire might visit villages on the edge of their home terrain to lure away villagers, but always attack victims within earshot to make sure that other villagers hear the screams. A witchfire might also ally with other hags or witches and even join their covens, but a witchfire is incapable of forming covens entirely on their own.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.52CdldlWMiVTZk1F]

The witchfire adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0XP2XOxT9VSiXFDr]{Phantasmal Calamity}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i1TvBID5QLyXrUCa]{Summon Entity} to their coven's spells.

A coven can contain one or more witchfires, but it must also include at least one living creature capable of forming a coven; three witchfires cannot form a coven.

action->Opportune Witchflame.name: Opportune Witchflame
action->Opportune Witchflame.description:
Trigger A creature makes a melee Strike against or touches the witchfire

Effect The witchfire makes a witchflame caress Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When the witchfire warden is destroyed, and as long as any creatures remain in stasis in this room, she reforms in [[/br 1d4 #Rejuvenation]]{1d4 days} at the soot-blackened pillar, fully healed.

action->Witchflame.name: Witchflame
action->Witchflame.description:
Any creature that takes void damage from a witchfire's Strike must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to witchflame for 1 hour.

Success The creature appears to catch fire with sickly green flames. These flames deal no damage on their own, but as long as the flames burn, the creature can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} rather than being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}) and gains weakness 5 to fire for 1 round.

Failure As success, but the effect is permanent until removed.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature gains weakness 10 to fire.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.NHwmrSyF0e8HUE3m]{Effect: Witchflame (Success)}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.L7SiTshdimUPWfnB]{Effect: Witchflame (Failure)}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.McawF8weCe7O81um]{Effect: Witchflame (Critical Failure)}

action->Witchflame Kindling.name: Witchflame Kindling
action->Witchflame Kindling.description:
Requirements A creature within 30 feet of the witchfire burns with witchflame

Effect The witchfire's eyes and mouth glow brightly, and the witchflame on the target creature momentarily burns much hotter, dealing @Damage[5d6[fire],5d6[void]]{5d6 fire damage and 5d6 void damage} to that creature (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|basic:true] save).

The witchfire can't use Witchflame Kindling for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Witchflame Kindling]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Claustrophobia.name: Claustrophobia
action->Claustrophobia.description:
Wrin becomes overwhelmed when she's underground, or when she's in an indoor space that's smaller than 10 feet in diameter.

At these times, she is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and can't reduce her sickened condition until she's outside of the enclosed area.

action->Spirit Sight (Precise) 30 feet.name: Spirit Sight (Precise) 30 feet
action->Spirit Sight (Precise) 30 feet.description: Wrin can see creatures with the spirit trait within 30 feet, regardless of whether they are visible to the naked eye. This ability sometimes allows Wrin to notice other supernatural auras, such as the buildup of spiritual energy atop Gauntlight.

action->Blood Magic.name: Blood Magic
action->Blood Magic.description: When Wrin casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IihxWhRfpsBgQ5jS]{Enthrall}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IkS3lDGUpIOMug7v]{Faerie Dust}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.atlgGNI1E1Ox3O3a]{Ghost Sound}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv]{Laughing Fit}, fey glamours dance around Wrin or one target of the spell, causing them to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} for 1 round. Such obvious concealment can't be used to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}.

action->Read the Stars.name: Read the Stars
action->Read the Stars.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Wrin attempts to read the future in the stars by spending an hour studying the night sky-she can't use this ability during the day, on an overcast night, or when she can't otherwise study the stars. Although Wrin usually performs this reading for an individual person or to answer a pressing question she has, for the purposes of this campaign she reads the stars for the party as a whole. She attempts an @Check[type:astrology-lore] check, using the DC appropriate for the heroes' current level.

Critical Success The results of Wrin's astrological readings have the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pkcOby5prOausy1k]{Read Omens}, and the heroes gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws for 24 hours.

Success The results of Wrin's astrological readings have the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury}, but can predict results up to 24 hours into the future.

Failure No reading.

Critical Failure Wrin brushes against hostile spiritual forces, and cannot for 1 week.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.rbgXQqXbpaQCcNNx]{Effect: Read the Stars (Critical Success)}

Ysondkhelir.name: Ysondkhelir
Ysondkhelir.publicNotes:
Slavers and raiders from the cold, windswept dimension of Leng, these malevolent humanoids range across reality in ominous black ships capable of sailing beyond the borders of dimensions and planes. Although most denizens of Leng seek slaves and plunder like any pirate, others operate as self-styled ambassadors and merchants, sowing discord with far-ranging plots. While the inscrutable denizens dress themselves in flowing robes, veils, and broad turbans to appear human, their aberrant physiology, when glimpsed, is evident from their crown of stubby horns and tentacled jaws to their furry, goat-like legs.

Above the fierce captains who command the infamous black ships are an even higher caste of denizens of Leng. These cultists and musicians serve as high priests, laboring to appease the frightening gods who look down upon the Nightmare Realm with cold malice.

action->Planar Fast Healing.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]
Planar Fast Healing
action->Planar Fast Healing.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]

A denizen of Leng maintains a connection to Leng at all times, and when away from Leng, they have fast healing 5. They lose this ability on Leng or in areas where planar connections do not function. If killed, their body dissolves into nothingness in [[/br 1d4 #Dissolve Body]]{1d4 rounds}, leaving behind their equipment. A slain denizen reforms in Leng; they can be permanently killed only when their planar fast healing doesn't function.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FastHealing]

action->No Breath.name: No Breath
action->No Breath.description: Denizens of Leng don't need to breathe.

action->Debilitating Bite.name: Debilitating Bite
action->Debilitating Bite.description: A creature that takes damage from a denizen's bite must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}. Each time a target fails an additional save against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 (to a maximum of Clumsy 4). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.

action->Leng Ruby.name: Leng Ruby
action->Leng Ruby.description: Many denizens of Leng carry strange rubies mined from quarries in Leng. As long as a creature holds a Leng ruby that it willingly accepted as a gift or payment from a denizen of Leng, any denizen of Leng can target that creature with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KHnhPHL4x1AQHfbC]{Mind Reading} at a range of 1 mile, and the bearer uses an outcome one degree of success worse than the result of its saving throw against Outcast's Curse.
